hanzi-su-wiki:
評

Значения

Суждение, отзыв, критика

Мнемоника

Критикуешь — говори 言 взвешенно 平, а то сам пострадаешь.

Варианты

评
purpleculture_pinyin:
píng
to discuss; to comment; to criticize; to judge; to choose (by public appraisal)
обсуждать; комментировать; критиковать; судить; выбрать (по общественной оценке)

heisig_chinese_memo: Good evaluateing should always be words of even fairness.
heisig_constituent: evaluate, say, words, keitai, mouth, even, water-lily, lily pad
koohiiStory1: Good evaluation should always be words of even fairness.
koohiiStory2: You get an evaluation copy of MS Word because you want to evaluate whether it´s worth buying the full version. At the end of the evaluation period the CD turns into a lilypad so you can´t use it any more (an innovative new copy-protection trick).
jp_example_words:
好評(こうひょう): popularity, favorable reputation
書評(しょひょう): book review
不評(ふひょう): bad reputation, disgrace, unpopularity
批評(ひひょう): criticism, review, commentary
評価(ひょうか): valuation, estimation, assessment, evaluation
評判(ひょうばん): fame, reputation, popularity, arrant
評論(ひょうろん): criticism, critique
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: You should say your peace before you evaluate a situation. That way everyone will know where you’re coming from. If you’re honest and say your peace before you evaluate a situation out loud, everyone will know where you stand.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: What situation would you like to evaluate? Be sure to say your peace before doing so. Imagine yourself doing this out loud and think of what you would say.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: While you say your peace, you end up making a really bad pun and you hear somebody say “Heyo!” (ひょう) You look at the people around you and try to evaluate who said heyo, but you can’t tell. You start talking again when somebody exclaims “That’s what she said” and another person shouts “Heyo!” once again, but you still can’t evaluate who’s saying these things.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine yourself trying to explain a situation you’re about to evaluate and your audience keeps shouting “Heyo!” every other sentence. Imagine how frustrating that would be. Get angry at your rude audience and how much they shout “Heyo.”
Ru_Radicals: 一 (один), ｜, 二 (два), 并, 言 (слово)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: flat (平) words (言) equals criticism
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: To evaluate well should always be words of even fairness.
humanum_full_description_en:
From " yan " to " ping " sound, the original meaning is comment and evaluation. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty·Xu Shao Biography": "Shao and Jing both have high reputations, and they are good at discussing the village party figures. They change their titles every month. Therefore, there is a "Yuedan Commentary" in Runan."

" Comment " can mean comments or comments. "Southern History‧Literature Biography‧Zhong Rong": "Rongpins ancient and modern poems as a commentary, expressing its advantages and disadvantages."

" Pan " also indicates the name of the style. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long-Lun Shuo": "Distinguishing history and commenting on the same line... the praiser is clear, the critic is fair."

" Comment " also expresses the name of the official, and the sentence will be decided by the hand. "Book of Jin‧ Official Records": "Ting Wei, in charge of criminal law and prison litigation, is a judge, prisoner, commentator, and a doctor of law."
humanum_short_description_en: From the " yan " and " ping " sound, the original meaning is comment and evaluation.
humanum_full_description:
從「言」，「平」聲，本義為評論、評定。《後漢書‧許劭傳》：「劭與靖俱有高名，好共覈論鄉黨人物，每月輒更其品題，故汝南俗有『月旦評』焉。」

　　「評」可表示評語、評論的話。《南史‧文學傳‧鍾嶸》：「嶸品古今詩為評，言其優劣。」

　　「評」也表示文體名。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧論說》：「辨史則與贊評齊行……贊者明意，評者平理。」

　　「評」還表示職官名，掌平決刑獄。《晉書‧職官志》：「廷尉，主刑法獄訟，屬官有正、監、評，並有律博士員。」
humanum_short_description: 從「言」，「平」聲，本義為評論、評定。

從「 言 」，「 平 」聲，本義為評論、評定。《後漢書‧許劭傳》：「劭與靖俱有高名，好共覈論鄉黨人物，每月輒更其品題，故汝南俗有『月旦評』焉。」 「 評 」可表示評語、評論的話。《南史‧文學傳‧鍾嶸》：「嶸品古今詩為評，言其優劣。」 「 評 」也表示文體名。南朝梁劉勰《文心雕龍‧論說》：「辨史則與贊評齊行……贊者明意，評者平理。」 「 評 」還表示職官名，掌平決刑獄。《晉書‧職官志》：「廷尉，主刑法獄訟，屬官有正、監、評，並有律博士員。」
From " yan" to " ping" sound, the original meaning is comment and evaluation. "The Book of the Later Han Dynasty·Xu Shao Biography": "Shao and Jing both have high reputations, and they are good at discussing the village party figures. They change their titles every month. Therefore, there is a "Yuedan Commentary" in Runan." " Comment" can mean comments or comments. "Southern History‧Literature Biography‧Zhong Rong": "Rongpins ancient and modern poems as a commentary, expressing its advantages and disadvantages." " Pan" also indicates the name of the style. The Southern Dynasties Liang Liu Xie's "Wen Xin Diao Long-Lun Shuo": "Distinguishing history and commenting on the same line... the praiser is clear, the critic is fair." " Comment" also expresses the name of the official, and the sentence will be decided by the hand. "Book of Jin‧ Official Records": "Ting Wei, in charge of criminal law and prison litigation, is a judge, prisoner, commentator, and a doctor of law."

評字的基本解释

評
píng
见“评”。

評字的汉语字典释义

[①]［píng］
［《廣韻》符兵切，平庚，並。］
［《廣韻》皮命切，去映，並。］
“评1”的繁体字。
(1)评论；评定。
(2)评语；评论的话。
(3)文体名。
(4)职官名。掌平决刑狱。
(5)指把脉。
(6)犁的一个部件。

評字的康熙字典解释

【酉集上】【言字部】　評； 康熙笔画：12； 页码：页1155第09
【廣韻】符兵切【集韻】【韻會】蒲兵切【正韻】蒲明切，?音平。【博雅】平也，議也。【廣韻】平量也。【增韻】品論也。【後漢·許劭傳】劭好覈論鄕黨人物，毎月更其品題，故汝南俗有月旦評焉。【魏志·曹植傳】曹植與邯鄲淳評說混元造化之端。【舊唐書·陸贄傳】互相譏評。【文心雕龍】評者，平理。【新論·正賞篇】評者，所以繩理也。　又官名。【晉書·職官志】廷尉主?法獄訟，屬官有正監評。【唐書·百官志】大理寺有評事八人，掌出使推按。　又邑名。【梁書·新羅國傳】其邑在內曰啄評，在外曰邑勒，亦中國之言郡縣也。　又姓，見【姓苑】。　又通作平。【後漢·霍諝傳】前者溫敎許爲平議。【蜀志·費褘傳】論平其是非。　又【玉篇】皮柄切【唐韻】【集韻】【正韻】皮命切，?平去聲。平言也。【韓愈·東都遇春詩】爾來曾幾時，白髮忽滿鏡。舊遊喜?張，新輩足嘲評。【註】評，音病。?張，乖張。

Comment
Name meaning
Nothing.
píng
appraise, criticize, evaluate
Radicals: 言, 平  (say, peace)
Meaning Mnemonic
You should say your peace before you evaluate a situation. That way everyone will know where you’re coming from. If you’re honest and say your peace before you evaluate a situation out loud, everyone will know where you stand.
What situation would you like to evaluate? Be sure to say your peace before doing so. Imagine yourself doing this out loud and think of what you would say.
Reading Mnemonic
While you say your peace, you end up making a really bad pun and you hear somebody say “Heyo!” (ひょう) You look at the people around you and try to evaluate who said heyo, but you can’t tell. You start talking again when somebody exclaims “That’s what she said” and another person shouts “Heyo!” once again, but you still can’t evaluate who’s saying these things.
Imagine yourself trying to explain a situation you’re about to evaluate and your audience keeps shouting “Heyo!” every other sentence. Imagine how frustrating that would be. Get angry at your rude audience and how much they shout “Heyo.”
